tr.td:
Elements defined in Ancestors:identifier, subject, description, code, onsetDate, endDate, category, clinicalStatus, resolutionCircumstances[x], severity, anatomicLocation[x], stage, diagnosisAssertionStatus, asserter, assertedDate
Condition HDR model
Instances of this logical model can be the target of a Reference

td.style: vertical-align: top; text-align : var(--ig-left,left); background-color: white; border: 0px #F0F0F0 solid; padding:0px 4px 0px 4px; white-space: nowrap; background-image: url(tbl_bck00.png)

a.title: Class of the problem (treated, other) in relation to the hospital encounter. Treated problems were treated or affected provisioning of care (diagnostics, therapy, nursing, monitoring) during the hospital encounter. At least one problem should be marked as Treated. Other problems are recorded only if they are important for continuity of care (after discharge).

description.value: EHDS refined base model for Condition HDR

definition.value: EHDS refined base model for Condition HDR
Condition identifier

short.value: Indicates the patient or group who the condition record is associated with.

definition.value: Indicates the patient or group who the condition record is associated with.
Condition specification in narrative form

short.value: Code identifying the condition, problem or diagnosis

definition.value: Code identifying the condition, problem or diagnosis

description.value: ICD-10*, SNOMED CT, Orphacode if rare disease is diagnosed

definition.value: Onset date of a problem/condition

short.value: The date or estimated date that the condition resolved or went into remission.

definition.value: The date or estimated date that the condition resolved or went into remission.

short.value: Category or categories of the problem.

definition.value: Category or categories of the problem.

short.value: Status of the condition/problem (active, resolved, inactive, ...)

definition.value: Status of the condition/problem (active, resolved, inactive, ...)

short.value: Describes the reason for which the status of the problem changed from current to inactive (e.g. surgical procedure, medical treatment, etc.).

definition.value: This field includes free text if the resolution circumstances are not already included in other fields such as surgical procedure, medical device, etc., e.g. hepatic cystectomy (this will be the resolution circumstances for the problem "hepatic cyst" and will be included in surgical procedures).

short.value: A subjective assessment of the severity of the condition as evaluated by the clinician.

definition.value: A subjective assessment of the severity of the condition as evaluated by the clinician.

short.value: The anatomical location including laterality where this condition manifests itself.

definition.value: The anatomical location including laterality where this condition manifests itself.

short.value: Stage/grade usually assessed formally using a specific staging/grading system. Multiple assessment systems could be used.

definition.value: Stage/grade usually assessed formally using a specific staging/grading system. Multiple assessment systems could be used.

short.value: Assertion about the certainty associated with a diagnosis. Diagnostic and/or clinical evidence of condition.

definition.value: Assertion about the certainty associated with a diagnosis. Diagnostic and/or clinical evidence of condition.
The asserter of the condition

short.value: Date and time of the diagnosis assertion

definition.value: Date and time of the diagnosis assertion
Category of the problem allows flagging for conditions acquired during hospital stay.- Present on admission [POA])- Hospital acquired condition [HAC]'- Not applicable or unknown

Class of the problem (treated, other) in relation to the hospital encounter. Treated problems were treated or affected provisioning of care (diagnostics, therapy, nursing, monitoring) during the hospital encounter. At least one problem should be marked as Treated. Other problems are recorded only if they are important for continuity of care (after discharge).
